column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////This was the first restaurant we visited during our Chicago trip - we went in with high expectations of the "best chicago pizza" (due to yelp and friends' reccos) and unfortunately left less than satisfied. The pizza was above average
column2: but the service ruined it for us. It was about 2:30pm on a Wednesday
column3: and our intended quick bite turned into a 2.5 hour venture. Upon ordering we were told it would take 35-40 min
column4: which was fine...but after an hour we were finally served a luke warm pizza - on top of that it wasn't what we had ordered. Asking for a side of ranch
column5: our bill and water refills took 20 min each. I'm pretty understanding when it comes to popular spots but there were hardly any tables filled. Decent pizza
